"By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed" (Hebrews 11:8).
üåÑ Abraham didn't know where he was going. But it was enough for him to know he was going with God. He didn't lean so much on God's promises as on God the Promiser. He didn't look at his difficult situation, but at the eternal, immortal, invisible King - the only wise God who had chosen his path and would prove Himself faithful.

The day had gone; alone and weak
I groped my way within a bleak
And sunless land.

The path that led into the light
I could not find! In that dark
night God took my hand.

He led me that I might not stray,
And brought me by a new, safe way
I had not known.

By waters still, through pastures green
I followed Him‚Äîthe path was clean
